events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their car on the highway, requesting initial claim registration.
The claim was categorised under auto accident based on the details provided about the vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle this auto accident claim and begin communications with the claimant.
Acknowledgement of the claim was sent to the customer confirming receipt of the accident details and next steps.
The claimant was requested to submit police reports, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates.
Claimant submitted all required documents, including the police report and photos showing extensive car damage.
The investigation team began reviewing all submitted evidence to assess the extent of liability and damage.
Investigation completed with confirmation that the insured was not at fault in the vehicle collision.
A settlement proposal was sent to the claimant covering the repair costs for the damaged vehicle.
Customer responded with gratitude and acceptance of the proposed settlement for their car repairs.
Approval was granted to process the payment for the approved auto accident claim settlement.
Payment amount covering the vehicle repair costs was issued to the insured's designated bank account.
The auto accident claim has been officially closed after successful payment and claimant satisfaction.
All documents and communications related to this car accident claim have been archived for record-keeping.
